Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in rejecting the refugee claim based on credibility regarding Baha'i faith and homosexuality
Decision_Level: Administrative decision by the Refugee Protection Division (IRB)
Credibility_Assessment: Board found applicant's testimony lacking credibility regarding conversion to Baha'i faith and homosexual orientation
Evidence_Type: Personal testimony, lack of documentary evidence, consistency of narrative
Legal_Provision: Section 96-97 of IRPA, Division 1 of Part 1 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Basis_of_Claim: Persecution based on religion (Baha'i) and sexual orientation (homosexuality) in Iran
Proceeding_Type: Refugee protection proceeding followed by judicial review
Review_Outcome: No error found; Board’s decision upheld
Application_Factor: Consistency of testimony, plausibility of events, corroboration
Decision_Outcome: Refugee claim dismissed due to credibility concerns
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Rule: Federal Court defers to Board’s credibility findings unless logically unsupportable
Cause_of_Refusal: Doubt about genuine adherence to Baha'i faith and authenticity of homosexual identity
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of supporting documentation for religious conversion and same-sex relationships
Procedural_Fairness: Claimant had opportunity to present evidence and be heard
Credibility_Issues: Inconsistencies in testimony, lack of detail, absence of corroborative evidence
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of credibility findings
Jurisdictional_Focus: Canada – Federal immigration and refugee law
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Charter of Rights and Freedoms (implied)
Procedural_Issue: Standard of review on judicial review of administrative decisions
Omission_Type: Failure to provide sufficient evidence to support key claims
